(2) The hero of the book of Daniel. Nothing is known of his parentage, though he appears to have been of royal descent (
); he was taken captive to Babylon and received the name of Belteshazzar (
). Along with three others he refused the “king’s meat” from fear of defilement (
). He then won the favor of Nebuchadnezzar and Darius by his power of interpreting dreams (
) and the handwriting on the wall (
). In consequence of a plot on the part of his enemies he was thrown into a den of lions (

. Interesting points of resemblance may be noticed between the history of Daniel and that of Joseph.
